Sweete sweetned be the houres, the daies, the monthes and times,</br>Wherein with sweet conceipts my soule, thy sweetened favor climes</br>Sweete be thy lookes, thy touch, thy speach, thy gate and all</br>Ten thousand sweets betide thee still, whose sweetnes staines them all.</br>Ye floures whose motlie hues so pranke in Natures pride,</br>Do shrowd your selves, and for my sweete, your beauties lay aside.</br>Ye temprate westerne winds, whose aire yeilds sweetned breath</br>Denie your sweete to be as hers, whose sweet yeelds life or death</br>Ye deintie tuned fowles whose notes do decke the spring</br>Confesse in hearing of her soundes, your sweets small pleasure bring</br>Ye christall sacred springs, ye vales and mountaines hie,</br>Whose pleasant walkes her passage decks, and spreading favours die</br>Agree with me in this, my sweete (surpassing far)</br>Excels the sweetnes of you all, and doth your pleasures bar.</br>
